thread.section_title: NWAonline stories: High School Sports - Northwest Arkansas
thread.title: Ott’s birdies hold off field

title: Ott’s birdies hold off field
text:
Ott’s birdies hold off field By Tim Cooper Posted: October 16, 2015 at 2:37 a.m. Rick McFarland Conway’s Casey Ott won the girls overall championship with a 4-over-par 76, defeating Brooke Matthews of Rogers, Hannah Bakalekos of North Little Rock, Katelyn Dunstan of Baptist Prep and Elizabeth Moon of Wynne by one stroke. 
Casey Ott is quickly learning how big one stroke can be. 
A year ago, Ott missed qualifying for the girls' High School Overall Golf Championship by one stroke. On Thursday, the Conway sophomore won the event by a single shot, holding off four others for the title. 
"I'm feeling really good about this one," said Ott, who shot a 4-over 76 on the 5,771-yard course at Pleasant Valley Country Club. "I'm really happy that I made it here, and I'm really happy I played as well as I did." 
Ott made a tournament-high five birdies, including two on the final four holes. Ott also had seven bogeys and a double bogey. 
"Those birdies definitely helped knock off some of the bad holes I had," Ott said. "My goal was to shoot a 74. I didn't think a 76 would win with all the great competitors that were out there today." 
Rogers junior Brooke Matthews, North Little Rock junior Hannah Bakalekos, Wynne junior Elizabeth Moon and Baptist Prep sophomore Katelyn Dunstan all posted 77s on a clear, hot and windy afternoon. 
Matthews, the 2014 Overall champion, earned runner-up honors when she parred the first playoff hole. Bakalekos secured third place when she parred the second extra hole while Moon and Dunstan both made bogey. 
Matthews struggled early Thursday, dropping three strokes on the first two holes, but the University of Arkansas commitment was only 2 over on her final 16 holes. 
"There was just a lot of stuff out there where I felt like I just made some stupid mistakes," Matthews said. "I could have done better, but it's OK." 
Matthews and Ott traded places from the Class 7A state tournament two weeks ago in Conway. Matthews birdied the final hole of that two-day event to earn a one-stroke victory. 
"Casey is one of my best friends and I'm really happy for her," Matthews said. "Coming down the stretch, I didn't know what the scores looked like. I was just trying to make a few birdies. Unfortunately for me, that didn't happen." 
Bakalekos, who also finished third in the 7A tournament, turned in the top score on the back nine with an even-par 36. Bakalekos played the first seven holes in 1 over, but the North Little Rock junior took a triple bogey on No. 8 and a bogey on No. 9. 
Ott was especially pleased with her birdie on the par-4 No. 15, which is regarded as the second-toughest hole on the course. 
"I used a wedge [on the approach shot] and stuck it to within 3 feet," Ott said. "I was happy with that one." 
Ott's victory marked the third consecutive year that a sophomore has won the Overall title. 
The tournament was sponsored by the Arkansas Women's Golf Association. 
Sports on 10/16/2015
